Description: Typical range for industrial Nd:YAG lasers cleaning delicate optics like fused silica to avoid thermal damage; starting at 100 W for light contamination removal. Max safe below substrate ablation threshold (~10 J/cm² fluence limit). Source: Manufacturer specs from IPG Photonics YLR series and academic review in Optics Express (2018) on laser cleaning of silica optics.
Near-IR wavelength providing optimal absorption balance for Fused Silica contamination removal
Optimal beam spot diameter for precision cleaning with sufficient energy density
High repetition rate for efficient cleaning coverage while maintaining thermal management
Nanosecond pulse duration for efficient contaminant ablation with minimal substrate heating
Optimal scanning speed for uniform cleaning coverage and process efficiency
Recommended number of cleaning passes for complete contaminant removal
Optimal beam overlap percentage for uniform cleaning without excessive energy deposition
